DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Safety Three Insulin Protocols Medical Intensive Care Unit Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Strict glycemic control recommend critically ill patient . However , implementation may face difficulty increase nursing workload , inadequate glucose control high risk hypoglycemia . We design computer guide protocol adjust endovenous insulin infusion aim glucose level 100mg/dl 130 mg/dl . This trial evaluate efficacy safety protocol ( algorithm A ) , compare standard endovenous insulin infusion protocol ( algorithm B ) conventional subcutaneous insulin protocol ( algorithm C ) . Methods : MICU patient least one blood glucose ≥ 150 mg/dL mechanical ventilation , SIRS , admit trauma burn randomize one follow treatment : algorithm A - continuous insulin infusion adjustment guide hand hold device desktop software target glucose level 100mg/dL-130mg/dL ; algorithm B - continuous insulin aim glucose level 80mg/dl-110mg/dl use Van den Berghe 's insulin protocol ; algorithm C - conventional treatment - intermittent subcutaneous administration insulin blood glucose level exceed 150mg/dL ; insulin administer IV bolus hypotensive patient . The randomization list generate block six computer software . Patients randomly assign 1:1:1 ratio glucose control one three insulin algorithm use central , computerized system access Internet , permit concealment allocation list . Randomization stratify accord study site . The study plan enroll 165 patient order 80 % power detect 20mg/dl difference blood glucose mean group , assume standard deviation equal 33 mg/dl two-tailed alpha equal 0.05 . Efficacy measure mean patient ' median blood glucose safety measure incidence hypoglycemia ( ≤40 mg/dL ) . Analysis follow intention-to-treat principle .
